Articles.Content:
Was there an update to KSP? I'm on Steam so not always sure when an update/patch is released but this morning I start up and all my existing planes are now wack with the SAS. They're constantly rotating left making flying pretty much impossible. Anyone else? I'm running V0.25.0.642

Currently only have MechJeb mod loaded, I know you're going to ask.

Edited November 4, 2014 by Jean Deaux

Wrong area. Just saying. This should be support or gameplay questions. First of all, uninstall mechjeb. Then try it. I don't really have much else advice, except you should contact a mod to have this either locked or moved. You will get more specific attention in the proper regions of the forum. Cheers

ToTheMun

Well, BEFORE I uninstall and put in a support ticket, I'm trying to find out if it's just affecting me. Sounds like you're not suffering. Apparently it's all SAS, I gave up trying to fly and went rocket and they're not working either. So if nobody else has this issue, I'll probably do a fresh install.

Wait, the craft were from a previous save, correct? No I am not having this issue, but it could be linked to your crafts being from a previous save. Although I don't think SAS has been changed in the 0.25 update...

I'm just saying everything was working fine for me yesterday, but all wack today. So if there wasn't a patch last night through steam, then something gone's corrupt for me. I just tried an integrity check via steam, so looks like my next step is a re-install.
Yep, something wen't corrupt. Fresh install and problem gone, was even able to re-use my game save and persistent files so nothing lost.

I just started a .25 game 2 days ago to play around and my ship started rotating for no reason like as if my Q button was stuck. The only way to stop it was to turn on mechjeb's KillRot, or use any other button, prograde, retrograde etc... Turning on SAS didn't stop the spinning. The RCS thrusters were actually firing...i even restarted KSP and it still did it. Flew the rest of the mission with KillRot on... Also, I couldn't rotate at all in the other direction using E.

I've run into this problem when I Alt-Tab out of the game and come back. When I looked at the control indicators in the lower left, the roll was pegged all the way to the left, and I was able to reproduce it every time. Changing the scene, by entering the VAB and exiting, fixed it.
